articles.author: WAFAA SHURAFA and SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Israeli strikes on homes in the northern Gaza Strip overnight and into Sunday left at least 87 people dead or missing, the territory's Health Ministry said, as a large-scale operation continued against Hamas militants said to be regrouping.
articles.title: Israeli strikes on northern Gaza leave at least 87 dead or missing, Palestinian officials say

articles.author: ZEKE MILLER, MIKE BALSAMO, ERIC TUCKER and TARA COPP
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The United States is investigating an unauthorized release of classified documents that assess Israel's plans to attack Iran, three U.S.
articles.title: The US is investigating an unauthorized release of classified documents on Israel's attack plans

articles.author: RUSS BYNUM and EMILY WAGSTER PETTUS
articles.description: SAVANNAH, Ga. (AP) — Georgia authorities said Sunday they are investigating the “catastrophic failure” of a dock gangway that collapsed and killed seven on Sapelo Island, where crowds had gathered for a fall celebration by the island’s tiny Gullah-Geechee community of Black slave descendants.
articles.title: Georgia authorities investigating 'catastrophic failure' of dock gangway that collapsed, killing 7

articles.author: COLLEEN LONG
articles.description: STONECREST, Ga. (AP) — Kamala Harris told the congregation of a large Black church in suburban Atlanta on Sunday that people must show compassion and respect in their daily lives and do more than just “preach the values.”
articles.title: Harris tells Black churchgoers that people must show compassion and respect in their lives

articles.author: MATT BROWN
articles.description: LIVONIA, Mich. (AP) — Standing before hundreds of people in a suburban Detroit chapel, at an event organized by Donald Trump's campaign, Marlin J. Reed declared that God had called on them to vote for the former president.
articles.title: Trump boosts a hard-right Christian worldview that paints the election as 'spiritual warfare'

articles.author: COREY WILLIAMS and MIKE HOUSEHOLDER
articles.description: BLOOMFIELD TOWNSHIP, Mich. (AP) — The lawn of Nick Hannawa's suburban Detroit home is lined with political signs backing candidates for prosecutor, supervisor and local trustee. But Hannawa isn't promoting his presidential pick.
articles.title: In part of swing state Michigan, neighbors skip presidential signs in a heated campaign season

articles.author: MILEXSY DURAN
articles.description: HAVANA (AP) — Many Cubans were waiting in anguish on Sunday as electricity on much of the island has yet to be totally restored after days of blackout.
articles.title: Cubans struggle as power not fully restored to the island after days of blackout

articles.description: MIAMI (AP) — Hurricane Oscar made landfall early Sunday in the southeastern Bahamas and was heading toward Cuba, an island recently beleaguered by a massive power outage.The National Hurricane Center in Miami said the storm's center arrived on Great Inagua island.
articles.title: Hurricane Oscar makes landfall in the Bahamas and heads toward Cuba

articles.author: HANNA ARHIROVA
articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — President Volodymyr Zelenskyy’s plan to end Ukraine’s nearly three-year war with Russia has received mixed reactions from Western allies so far.
articles.title: Ukraine’s ‘victory plan’ receives mixed reactions from Western allies

articles.author: GIOVANNA DELL'ORTO
articles.description: CAMBRIDGE, New York (AP) — After he and his fellow monks sang morning prayers in their church nestled in a forest, Brother Luke walked back to his residence to be greeted by a different kind of choir.
articles.title: Learning about God from dogs, Orthodox monks breed and train canines in upstate New York monastery
